div.div: 1. We want to download HTML pages, not images, or videos, but
we can make our system extensible
2. We want the system to be polite and not bombard serves with
We want to download 1 Billions websites per month

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: 1. Seed URL is the starting point. We should choose a good starting point for the seed URLs
2. URL Frontier is the service that handles the URL that needs to be downloaded
3. HTML downloader talks with DNS resolver to get the IP Address of the site before downloading it
4. The content parser parses the content of the site, in our case we care about HTML
5. We check if the content is seen before? if Yes, we discard it, otherwise we store it
7. The extracted links to be filtered for blocklisted links or malicious links.
8. The URLs are checked if they been seen before, if yes, we discard them, otherwise we
store them in URL storage and send them to the URL frontier to be prepared for downloading.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 305px; margin-left: 632px;

div.div: We can think of websites and how they are linked together

div.span: So, we have 2 options of crawling
we can just say we are using BFS
of which sites to process first.
